results.title: Writing better business letters
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Emphasizes the three principle characteristics of a good business letter - clarity, brevity, and courtesy. States the simple principle of letter writing, how to write letters easily and naturally.

results.title: Writers & revolutionaries
results.creator_credit: Steve Talley, Alex Gibney, Teleac Holland, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Pacific century”.
Revolutions often arise from the writings of men of ideas. This program looks at the crucial influence of Lu Xun and Kita Ikki on the Chinese revolution and the revolutionary transformation of Japan into a dominant military and economic power. Lu Xun set out to destroy traditional Chinese culture which he saw as backward, corrupt and complacent and became the greatest Chinese author of the 20th century and a major influence on Mao. Kita Ikki, by contrast sought a return to a pure and traditional spirit of nationalism which led to Japan’s imperialism prior to World War II. Rare archival footage, some of which is very distressing, enhances this fascinating program. A study guide and faculty manual is also available.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Talley, Alex Gibney, Teleac Holland, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions

results.title: Writers' block
results.brief_description: Writer’s block was developed as a character-driven interactive that gives the user the opportunity to view characters involved in the creative process of writing; including having trouble with muses and getting distracted by too many coffee breaks. The CDROM also contains practical information for would be authors ranging from getting started as a writer through to organising a poetry reading.

results.title: Write Your Own Ticket
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Seven Dimensions and Ted Robinson
results.brief_description: Ron Barassi outlines a strategy for setting and achieving goals that relate to career plans, study, ambitions, sports, work and fitness. Decide on future directions; list goals and their purpose; and determine schedule and personal cost.

results.title: Wrestling fundamentals
results.creator_credit: D Richardson and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: The film illustrates the moves and countermoves required in good amateur wrestling. Illustrates rules, takedowns, pinholds and the techniques of chain wrestling.

results.title: WR. Mysteries of the organism (E)
results.brief_description: Dusan Makavejev’s collage approach to “Wr. Mysteries of the Organism” effectively connects a disparate collection of themes, styles and ideas, starting with a documentary on controversial Polish born sexologist Wilheim Reich, a panorama of the American sexual revolution of the 60’s and 70’s, and finally, a satire set in the former Yugoslavia on the sexually repressive nature of authoritarian movements. The Reich segment covers the famed psychologists career from his flight from Europe in the late 30’s to his settlement in the United States where he established his research laboratory. His unconventional studies on ‘orgone energy’, coupled with his communist background made him a prime target for McCarthy’s communist witchhunts, resulting in his books being burned and his eventual incarceration and death in prison. Makavejev juxtaposes Reich’s life work with a fictional narrative of a liberated Yugoslavian woman (Milena Dravic), trying to enlighten a politically indocrinated and repressed Russian skater (Vladimir Ilyich) to the Reichian ethos of revolution via free love. In English language with some subtitles (Note: This particular version of “Wr. Mysteries of the Organism” is a modified version specially prepared by Makavejev to comply with British television standards.) See also “The Switchboard operator” (1969), “The Coca Cola kid” (1985).
